etymology.description: 说(say) + 话(speech/words) = to speak; to talk
etymology.interpretation: Combines the act of saying with “speech/words” to denote producing utterance. Functions as a common verb–object compound in Mandarin.
etymology.simplification: Both characters simplify the speech radical 言 to 讠 for high-frequency use; 說 → 说 streamlines the 兌 component to 兑, and 話 → 话 reduces strokes while keeping 舌 as the core element.

parts.english: to speak; to say; to explain; to persuade

examples.chinese: 请小声说话(請小聲說話)
他说话很快(他說話很快)
别在图书馆大声说话(別在圖書館大聲說話)
examples.english: Don’t speak loudly in the library.
